ray.rage.asset

Interface AssetLoader<T extends Asset>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - A generic type that extends the asset interface.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Disposable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    AnimationLoader, MaterialLoader, MeshLoader, ShaderLoader, SkeletonLoader, TextureLoader
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GlslShaderLoader, RgbaTextureLoader, SkeletalAnimationLoader, SkeletalMeshLoader, SkeletalSkeletonLoader, WavefrontMaterialLoader, WavefrontMeshLoader

    public interface AssetLoader<T extends Asset>
extends Disposable
    An asset loader is responsible for loading the raw data of an asset directly from the file system and transforming it into a format that's meaningful to, and usable by, the framework.

    Implementation classes need to understand and process the internal storage format used to represent the assets directly in the file system (e.g. XML document) in order to allow concrete asset instances to exist with meaningful values.

    Loaders are not intended to be used directly. Rather, they're meant to be registered with the corresponding asset-managers so that the asset-managers can select the correct loader at run-time based on the asset's file extension.

    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera
    See Also:
    Asset, AssetManager

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void loadAsset(T dst, java.nio.file.Path src)
      Reads the data from the specified path on disk, extracts the necessary information, and assigns it to the specified asset.

      • Methods inherited from interface ray.rage.common.Disposable

        notifyDispose

    • Method Detail

      • loadAsset

        void loadAsset(T dst,
               java.nio.file.Path src)
        throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the data from the specified path on disk, extracts the necessary information, and assigns it to the specified asset.
        Parameters:
        dst - The asset instance to be initialized.
        src - The file system path where the asset's data will be loaded from.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the data cannot be read from the file system.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the asset is null
